elements.text:
A random person comes up to you to ask you a question, but all you can manage in response is a quiet mumble they can't hear. You start wondering what their response will be.

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

texts: I try to smile to show that I am not being rude.
I accept the situation I'm in and do my best to think of alternative ways of communicating.
I want to express my frustration at this difficulty, but I accept this is my condition and do my best.
I turn away before the person has a chance to respond to avoid any potentially negative interaction.
I feel like avoiding the interaction after, but I meet their gaze to try and convey that I am engaged with them.
